item.title: TryHackMe - Vulnversity
item.description: The room link can be found at TryHackMe - Vulnversity Reconnaissance Nmap First we do a simple nmap scan PORT STATE SERVICE 21/tcp open ftp 22/tcp open ssh 139/tcp open netbios-ssn 445/tcp open microsoft-ds 3128/tcp open squid-http 3333/tcp open dec-notes We find six ports open, we can now make a more in depth scan with nmap -sC -sV $IP. It will found the service type and version. PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 21/tcp open ftp vsftpd 3.

item.title: TryHackMe - Easy Peasy
item.description: The room link can be found at TryHackMe - Easy Peasy Enumeration First we scan for open ports and services Nmap We use nmap with some default arguments. sudo nmap -sV -sC -oA nmap/first $IP It will return. PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 80/tcp open http nginx 1.16.1 | http-robots.txt: 1 disallowed entry |_/ |_http-server-header: nginx/1.16.1 |_http-title: Welcome to nginx! From the first scan we can see that port 80 is open with nginx version 1.
